Pre-Game Insights: The sport’s oldest rivalry between co-hosts United States and northern neighbours Canada will get the ball rolling in the biggest ICC Men’s Twenty20 World Cup on Saturday.
United States vice-captain Aaron Jones said the co-hosts were determined to play a 'fearless' brand of the sport in a bid to advance to the Super Eight quarterfinals out of Group 'A'.
Canada captain Saad Bin Zafar expressed a similar sentiment about playing 'fearless cricket' and playing to their potential.
The Americans have won four of their seven men’s T20Is against Canada, including a 4-0 series win when the sides met in April.
The co-hosts have won six of their seven T20Is at Grand Prairie, where they mounted their highest T20I total of 230 against the Canadians on April 9.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Americans and Canadians met in the first international cricket match 180 years ago, and it is fitting that they are set to renew that rivalry at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas, Texas.
Both United States and Canada are making their debut appearance at a men’s T20 World Cup.
The United States qualified as co-hosts, while Canada qualified ahead of Bermuda through the Americas Regional Final with a superior run rate.
